page.title: 11PARISH OF TIBBERMORE (4)
page.content: On this "light" land, cereals are grown and Loanleven produces barley for malting for the production of whiskey, barley for brewing for the production of beer, oats for animal feeding and some for milling into oatmeal. We saw fields which were bright yellow with the flowers of oil seed rape, a crop which has only been grown for a few years. The seed is milled and the oil extracted for the manufacture of margarine and cooking oil. We were shown the Charolais and Limousin bulls which are used on the farm to breed Hereford, Friesian and Angus cows. About one hundred cattle are produced each year to supply beef, and sixty to seventy calves are fed over the winter in the cattle shed.
